item.description:
@sonny_bill_9 wrote:

[quote=“Tree, post:2, topic:203745”] String text = textField.getText();

I assume that is what you are looking for?

PS: Jason edited his post after looking at mine. What a little sheep.[/quote][quote=“Yz85Racer, post:3, topic:203745”][quote author=``jason link=topic=268141.msg2212644#msg2212644 date=1209915430]
String parent = textbox1.getText();
Or something like that under the button click void.
EDIT: I was wrong fixed it.
[/quote]
Stick to VB, please.[/quote]
OKOK i suck i get it.

item.title: java.swing.JTextField - As a string via JButton?
item.dc:creator: @i_own_pking i_own_pking
item.description:
@i_own_pking wrote:

Well, ive tried this but im not sure how to actually do it;

Here is the quick application i put together.

I want to know how to make the text in the Parent id box become a String when the JButton is clicked.

For example;

I have a string such as: public String parent = “”;

I would like to make it so that the contents is strung,

String parent = outcome; or whatever

Thanks for any help.
